com.camerontec.catalys.util.fast

Class FastOutputStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.OutputStream
      • java.io.FilterOutputStream
        • com.camerontec.catalys.util.fast.FastOutputStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, Flushable, AutoCloseable

    public class FastOutputStream
extends FilterOutputStream
    Output stream used to encode and send FAST messages.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FastOutputStream

        public FastOutputStream(OutputStream stream,
                        IFastContext fastContext,
                        boolean blockedFormat,
                        int overlongBlocksizeLength)
                 throws TemplateException
        Create new FastOutputStream that writes FAST encoded data to the given underlying output stream.
        Parameters:
        stream - Underlying output stream where encoded bytes are written.
        fastContext - IFastContext to be used for processing FAST messages on this stream.
        blockedFormat - True if this stream uses blocks - see FAST spec in section on Transfer Encoding: "A FAST stream consists of a sequence of messages or a sequence of blocks." See flushBuffer() for how message blocks are defined.
        overlongBlocksizeLength - The length of the overlong integer after encoding (in bytes). Will be taken in consideration only if blocked format is used. If 0 supplied the normal (not overlong) integer will be used as a block size.
        Throws:
        TemplateException - If the template selector in the FastContext is not suitable

      • FastOutputStream

        Throws:
        TemplateException - If the template selector in the FastContext is not suitable

      • FastOutputStream

        public FastOutputStream(IFastContext fastContext,
                        boolean blockedFormat,
                        int overlongBlocksizeLength)
                 throws TemplateException
        Create new FastOutputStream. This constructor does not specify a stream to write to, so this must be done using setOutputStream before writing.
        Parameters:
        fastContext - IFastContext to be used for processing FAST messages on this stream.
        blockedFormat - True if this stream uses blocks - see FAST spec in section on Transfer Encoding: "A FAST stream consists of a sequence of messages or a sequence of blocks." See flushBuffer() for how message blocks are defined.
        overlongBlocksizeLength - The length of the overlong integer after encoding (in bytes). Will be taken in consideration only if blocked format is used. If 0 supplied the normal (not overlong) integer will be used as a block size.
        Throws:
        TemplateException - If the template selector in the FastContext is not suitable

        Throws:
        TemplateException - If the template selector in the FastContext is not suitable

    • Method Detail

      • flushBuffer

        public int flushBuffer()
                throws IOException,
                       FastCodecException
        Causes all written messages to be copy to the output stream.

        If blockedFormat is true, the messages written will form a FAST "block", prefixed by a block size in the output stream.

        IMPORTANT: After calling this method, SPY does not contain correct display. The reason is that SPY records references to the pmapContext's BytesSegement which are later returned to the free pool after resetting the buffer value to zeros. In order to display properly SPY, you need to follow this calling sequence:

        • Call flushBuffer(boolean) with true as argument
        • Display SPY (e.g. print SPY.toString()
        • Call freePoolBuffers()
        Returns:
        the number of bytes flushed to the output stream.
        Throws:
        IOException - If there is a problem writing to the output stream.
        FastCodecException - If there is a problem encoding the final data.

      • flushBuffer

        public int flushBuffer(boolean freePoolObjects)
                throws IOException,
                       FastCodecException
        Causes all written messages to be copy to the output stream.

        If blockedFormat is true, the messages written will form a FAST "block", prefixed by a block size in the output stream.

        IMPORTANT: If you call this method with 'freePoolObjects' set to false then pmap and data buffers will not be returned to the free pool and you must call freePoolBuffers() in order to achieve that. You need to follow this calling sequence:

        • Call flushBuffer(boolean) with true as argument
        • Display SPY (e.g. print SPY.toString()
        • Call freePoolBuffers()
        In case you are interested in SPY it is safer to call flushBuffer() as it will flish the buffer and returned pool objects in the same call.
        Parameters:
        freePoolObjects - If set to 'false' then pool objects are NOT freed.
        Returns:
        the number of bytes flushed to the output stream.
        Throws:
        IOException - If there is a problem writing to the output stream.
        FastCodecException - If there is a problem encoding the final data.

      • freePoolBuffers

        public void freePoolBuffers()
        Free pool objects by hand in case you need top display SPY value. see flushBuffer(boolean) for the correct calling sequence

      • getTemplateTag

        public int getTemplateTag()
        Tag of message field which contains templateID of template which should be used to encode message.

        Default is 0, indicating that templates are not selected this way.

        Returns:
        Tag of templateID field.
        See Also:
        setTemplateTag(int)

      • setTemplateTag

        public void setTemplateTag(int templateTag)
        Set tag of message field which contains the templateID of the template to be selected for encoding messages.

        Templates are not selected this way if the tag is not greater than 0.

        Fields with this tag in the message are not encoded.

        Parameters:
        templateTag - Tag to be used for template selection, or 0 if templates are not to be selected this way.
        See Also:
        getTemplateTag()

      • write

        public boolean write(IFastEncodableMessage msg)
              throws Exception
        Encodes the given message and writes the encoded data to the stream.
        Parameters:
        msg - Message to be FAST encoded and written.
        Returns:
        True if fields were written to the stream.
        Throws:
        Exception - If there was a problem writing the message

      • setHexOutput

        public void setHexOutput(String prefix)
        Indicates that encoded output should be written to the output stream in hex format, with each output line prefixed by the given prefix String.

        The format of the output following the prefix is a list of hex character pairs separated by space. For example:

        0a 7f b4 ae

        Parameters:
        prefix - String with which to prefix each line of output.

      • clearDictionaries

        public void clearDictionaries()
        Clear the dictionaries of the FAST context
